intro: Lutrostylis spinosa, commonly known as the spinous luteous-styled plant, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody structure and hairy leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the warmer months. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Lutrostylis spinosa is native to certain regions of Africa and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
